name: URigVMPin
doc:
The Pin represents a single connector / pin on a node in the RigVM model.
Pins can be connected based on rules. Pins also provide access to a 'PinPath',
which essentially represents . separated list of names to reach the pin within
the owning graph. PinPaths are unique.
In comparison to the EdGraph Pin the URigVMPin supports the concept of 'SubPins',
so child / parent relationships between pins. A FVector Pin for example might
have its X, Y and Z components as SubPins. Array Pins will have its elements as
SubPins, and so on.
A URigVMPin is owned solely by a URigVMNode.

methods.name: ContainsWildCardSubPin
methods.doc: Returns true if any of the subpins is a wildcard

methods.name: FindLinkForPin
methods.doc:
Returns the link that represents the connection
between this pin and InOtherPin. nullptr is returned
if the pins are not connected.

methods.name: FindSubPin
methods.doc: Returns a SubPin given a name / path or nullptr.

methods.name: GetAbsolutePinIndex
methods.doc: Returns the absolute index of the Pin within the node / parent Pin

methods.name: GetArrayElementCppType
methods.doc: Returns the C++ data type of an element of the Pin array

methods.name: GetArraySize
methods.doc: Returns the number of elements within an array Pin

methods.name: GetCPPType
methods.doc: Returns the C++ data type of the pin

methods.name: GetCPPTypeObject
methods.doc:
Returns the struct of the data type of the Pin,
or nullptr otherwise.

methods.name: GetCustomWidgetName
methods.doc:
Returns the name of a custom widget to be used
for editing the Pin.

methods.name: GetDefaultValue
methods.doc:
Returns the default value of the Pin as a string.
Note that this value is computed based on the Pin's
SubPins - so for example for a FVector typed Pin
the default value is actually composed out of the
default values of the X, Y and Z SubPins.

methods.name: GetDirection
methods.doc: Returns the direction of the pin

methods.name: GetDisplayName
methods.doc: Returns the display label of the pin

methods.name: GetEnum
methods.doc:
Returns the enum of the data type of the Pin,
or nullptr otherwise.

methods.name: GetGraph
methods.doc: Returns the graph of this Pin.

methods.name: GetLinkedSourcePins
methods.doc:
Returns all of the linked source Pins,
using this Pin as the target.

methods.name: GetLinkedTargetPins
methods.doc:
Returns all of the linked target Pins,
using this Pin as the source.

methods.name: GetLinks
methods.doc: Returns all of the links linked to this Pin.

methods.name: GetMetaData
methods.doc: Returns the keyed metadata associated with this pin, if any

methods.name: GetNode
methods.doc: Returns the node of this Pin.

methods.name: GetOriginalPinFromInjectedNode
methods.doc:
Returns the original pin for a pin on an injected
node. This can be used to determine where a link
should go in the user interface

methods.name: GetParentPin
methods.doc:
Returns the parent Pin - or nullptr if the Pin
is nested directly below a node.

methods.name: GetPinForLink
methods.doc:
Returns the pin to be used for a link.
This might differ from this actual pin, since
the pin might contain injected nodes.

methods.name: GetPinIndex
methods.doc: Returns the index of the Pin within the node / parent Pin

methods.name: GetPinPath
methods.doc:
Returns a . separated path containing all names of the pin and its owners,
this includes the node name, for example "Node.Color.R"

methods.name: GetRootPin
methods.doc:
Returns the top-most parent Pin, so for example
for "Node.Transform.Translation.X" this returns
the Pin for "Node.Transform".

methods.name: GetScriptStruct
methods.doc:
Returns the struct of the data type of the Pin,
or nullptr otherwise.

methods.name: GetSegmentPath
methods.doc:
Returns a . separated path containing all names of the pin within its main
memory owner / storage. This is typically used to create an offset pointer
within memory (FRigVMRegisterOffset).
So for example for a PinPath such as "Node.Transform.Translation.X" the
corresponding SegmentPath is "Translation.X", since the transform is the
storage / memory.

methods.name: GetSourceLinks
methods.doc:
Returns all of the source pins
using this Pin as the target.

methods.name: GetSubPinPath
methods.doc:
Returns a . separated path containing all names of the pin and its owners
until we hit the provided parent pin.

methods.name: GetSubPins
methods.doc: Returns all of the SubPins of this one.

methods.name: GetTargetLinks
methods.doc:
Returns all of the target links,
using this Pin as the source.

methods.name: GetToolTipText
methods.doc: Returns the tooltip of this pin

methods.name: IsArray
methods.doc: Returns true if the data type of the Pin is an array

methods.name: IsArrayElement
methods.doc: Returns true if the Pin is a SubPin within an array

methods.name: IsDecoratorPin
methods.doc: Returns true if this pin represents a decorator

methods.name: IsDefinedAsConstant
methods.doc: Returns true if the pin is defined as a constant value / literal

methods.name: IsDynamicArray
methods.doc: Returns true if this pin represents a dynamic array

methods.name: IsEnum
methods.doc: Returns true if the data type of the Pin is a enum

methods.name: IsExecuteContext
methods.doc: Returns true if the C++ data type is an execute context

methods.name: IsExpanded
methods.doc: Returns true if the pin is currently expanded

methods.name: IsFixedSizeArray
methods.doc: Returns true if this pin is an array that should be displayed as elements only

methods.name: IsInterface
methods.doc: Returns true if the data type of the Pin is a interface

methods.name: IsLazy
methods.doc: Returns true if this pin's value may be executed lazily

methods.name: IsLinkedTo
methods.doc: Returns true if this Pin is linked to another Pin

methods.name: IsReferenceCountedContainer
methods.doc: Returns true if this data type is referenced counted

methods.name: IsRootPin
methods.doc: Returns true if this pin is a root pin

methods.name: IsStringType
methods.doc: Returns true if the C++ data type is FString or FName

methods.name: IsStruct
methods.doc: Returns true if the data type of the Pin is a struct

methods.name: IsStructMember
methods.doc: Returns true if the Pin is a SubPin within a struct

methods.name: IsUObject
methods.doc: Returns true if the data type of the Pin is a uobject

methods.name: IsWildCard
methods.doc: Returns true if the C++ data type is unknown

methods.name: RequiresWatch
methods.doc: Returns true if the pin should be watched

methods.name: ShouldHideSubPins
methods.doc: Returns true if this pin's subpins should be hidden in the UI

methods.name: ShouldOnlyShowSubPins
methods.doc: Returns true if this pin is an array that should be displayed as elements only
